intro: Helicteres brevior, commonly known as the small-leaved hedge nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Helicteres brevior is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
